SENT.plain: Two cases of Hemophilus endocarditis were diagnosed in our hospital during a six-month period
Although both patients were in good health until the onset of their endocarditis, both had brain emboli and required emergency heart-valve surgery
Falsely low incidences of this disease have been reported, since Hemophilus sp are difficult to isolate
Additionally, these organisms are consistently associated with large vegetations and have a greater than 50% incidence of embolization
It is this higher incidence of embolization that leads us to conclude that prophylactic surgery should be considered in selected patients
